title: What's The Deal With Dead Man's Plate
body:
Who was he...?
How did he die?
Why is his armor magical?

One of the few items to have text with it, and that's it. Can we pleeeease get some cool backstory about this item. Like maybe it was Hecarim's armor when he was alive, working into the whole movement speed for damage niche, or maybe a champion we don't know about is gonna be resurrected from the dead and have the armors ability as a passive or something but whoever came up with the item reveal yourself and lemme know some details pretty please.

I edited my post to add an image... Yes, it is legit.

If this is the case, Riot needs to add a special interaction into the game. 

If an enemy champion buys Deadman's Plate while Gangplank is in the game, you hear Gangplank say something about his armor being missing.... then his character no longer has that piece of armor on for as long as that player owns that item.
Illaoi says “ this fits me better than gangplank”
i will have to get a custom going just to hear this lol, its always good when a Writer enlightens me xD

As far as i know, the whole thing is a replacement for his arm, so i dont think that he can take it off.

Can confirm. The Bilgewater event from 2015 was probably Riot's peak in that sense: a story in three+1 chapters released weekly, two reworks (MF and GP), one new game mode and Butcher's Bridge (with GP as the announcer). And one of the biggest plot twists in the history of League :D

If you weren't there at the time, go check the story out: https://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/site/bilgewater/#story-1 ;D



Spoiler (?): when GP's rework was announced he was [released](http://www.surrenderat20.net/2015/07/514-gangplank-and-miss-fortune-champion.html) with what is now the Captain Gangplank skin as his base. When he died in the story he was disabled (the client announcement read something like "GP is dead, can't play him anymore, sorry :P"), ~2 weeks later the last chapter of the story was released and GP was re-enabled again, btu this time with his actual look (and the [update reveal page](https://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/page/champion-update/gangplank-sails-pbe) was adjusted accordingly), and anyone who owned GP before his "death" was gifted the new Captain GP skin.
It's probably still the most memorable moment in my experience as a League player (and I don't even own GP! xD)

Given that the guy on the picture of the deadman's plate still seems to have a biological arm,I'd say it is more likely that its not  part of  his robot arm(though then again,maybe it keeps the whole thing together?)
It refers to Gangplank from the Burning Tides event
